definitions.definition: a group of officials led by an ambassador who represent their government in a foreign country

examples.text: to inform the embassy of the situation

definitions.definition: the building in which an embassy works

examples.text: a demonstration outside the Russian Embassy
a fire in the Spanish embassy
a protest outside the American embassy
They broke off diplomatic relations and closed the embassies in each other's country.
She works at the Malaysian embassy in Buenos Aires.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (originally also as ambassy denoting the position of ambassador): from Old French ambasse, based on Latin ambactus ‘servant’. Compare with ambassador.
